chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nyjuanan Andrew Gant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Nyjuanan Andrew Gant.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Court set another status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Nyjuanan Andrew Gant.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 8-25-22.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until 8-31-2022 at 2:00 pm for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for calendar call. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Suppress Illegal Search

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court set a calendar call date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense is waiting for discovery and requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Nyjuanan Andrew Gant in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nyjuanan Andrew Gant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
